results.title: Ferret keeping
results.brief_description: This video covers the basics of ferret management and breeding for those keeping ferrets for working, racing, or as pets. Advice on choosing a ferret, types of housing, and what to feed them. The video follows a kit (baby ferret), from birth to its care at different ages, and covers how to train, handle and breed. The video explores the myth of ferrets being aggressive animals, revealing how engaging and good-natured they can be. Presented by James McKay, zoologist, writer, broadcaster, and internationally acknowledged as one of the world’s leading authorities on ferrets.

results.title: FernGully: the Last rainforest (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: FAI Films, Youngheart Productions, Wayne Young, Peter Faiman and Bill Kroyer
results.brief_description: Dedicated to “our children and our children’s children”, the magical, mystical world of Fern Gully, the last rainforest takes us to a secret, special place filled with wonder and adventure where human beings exist only in fairy tales! Human hero Zak, shrunk to fairy size by Crysta, joins Batty Koda, an escapee from human lab and the denizens of the forest as they struggle to save the future of the forest from the evil enemy Hexxus. Voices include Tim Curry, Christian Slater and Robin Williams.

results.title: Fern the Red Deer (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A marvellous adventure story, filmed on location in remote Exmoor, about an abandoned deer calf. The deer calf forms a bond with two young children and together they fight for the wild deer’s survival. Rated: G

results.title: Feng shui today: enrich your life by design: with Jami Lin
results.brief_description: Feng Shui- the ancient Chinese art of placement, and the creation of positive and harmonious living environments that enhance abundance and well being, has made the transition from East to West. Jami Lin; author and lecturer, combines her expertise in Feng Shui with interior design to create this practical video about Earth Design, an integration of interior design and self development that captures Feng Shui on the domestic front.

results.title: Fences
results.brief_description: Early colonial settlers ran sheep on huge unenclosed areas of grazing lands, but when gold was discovered shepherds left the sheep-runs and flocked to the gold-fields. Sheep were “enclosed” and later fences were erected as protection against rabbits and wild dogs.

results.title: Femmes de Personne = Nobody's Women
results.brief_description:
Isabelle, Adeline and Cecile work in a radiology practice. Disappointed by relationships with men, they content themselves with chance encounters. In this indulgent piece on mid-life crisis in the middle classe, the male characters are presented as a collection of irresponsible, self-centred creatures while women battle to come to term with the great decisions in life such as child bearing and rearing, with force booze and cigarettes for solace.

Credits: Producer, Alain Terzian ; director, Christopher Frank ; writer, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Marthe Keller, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Caroline Cellier, Fanny Cottencon, Philippe Leotard.
